article:
The first day of school we were surprised to know a new classmate. I  _  around when a gentle hand touched my shoulder. I found a little  _  lady with a warm smile.
She said, "Hi! I'm 87 years old. Can I give you a hug? " I laughed and heartily  _  , "Of course!"
"Why are you in college at such a young, innocent  age?" I asked.
She replied, "I'm here to meet a rich husband, get married,  have  children, and then travel around."
"  _  ?"I asked. I  _  why she gave herself so much trouble at this age.
"I always  dreamed of  having a college education and now I'm getting one!" she told me. We became friends quickly..
  Over the year  , Rose became an icon  in the school and she easily made friends wherever she went. She loved to dress up and she enjoyed the  _  which was paid to her from the other students.
At the end of the term we invited Rose to speak at our football party. I'll never forget what she  _  us.
"We do not stop playing because we are old; we grow old  _  we stop playing. Here are the secrets to staying  _  . You have to laugh and find  _  every day. You've got to have a dream. When you lose your dreams, you die.  _  we have many people like this walking around!" she said.
"There is a huge  _  between growing older and growing up. Anybody can grow older. That doesn't  _  any gift or ability ," she added. "But growing up needs  _  the chance in change. Have no regrets. The old usually don't regret  _  they did, but rather things they did not do."
One weak after graduation that year,Rose died in peace in her sleep.She taught us  by example  that it's never too  _  to be all you can possibly be.
